intro: Polygala blanchetii, commonly known as the Blanquet's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, and it produces small, bead-like fruits. Polygala blanchetii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
